topic: Devolved Governments and Media in the UK

questions.question: Where are the Welsh Government and the Senedd based?
questions.explanation: The Welsh Government and the Senedd are located in Cardiff, the capital of Wales.

questions.question: How many members does the Senedd have?
questions.explanation: There are 60 Senedd Members (SMs) in the Welsh Parliament.

questions.question: How often are Senedd elections held?
questions.explanation: Elections to the Senedd are held every four years.

questions.question: What type of voting system is used in Senedd elections?
questions.explanation: The Senedd uses a form of proportional representation for its elections.

questions.question: Since what year has the Senedd been able to pass laws without UK Parliament approval?
questions.explanation: Since 2011, the Senedd has been able to pass laws without needing UK Parliament approval.

questions.question: How many areas can the Senedd make laws in?
questions.explanation: The Senedd has the power to make laws in 21 areas.

questions.question: When was the Scottish Parliament formed?
questions.explanation: The Scottish Parliament was established in 1999.

questions.question: Where does the Scottish Parliament sit?
questions.explanation: The Scottish Parliament sits in Edinburgh, the capital of Scotland.

questions.question: How many members does the Scottish Parliament have?
questions.explanation: The Scottish Parliament has 129 Members of the Scottish Parliament (MSPs).

questions.question: What kind of voting system is used for Scottish Parliament elections?
questions.explanation: Members of the Scottish Parliament are elected using proportional representation.

questions.question: When was the first Northern Ireland Parliament established?
questions.explanation: A Northern Ireland Parliament was established in 1922 when Ireland was divided.

questions.question: In what year was the Northern Ireland Parliament abolished?
questions.explanation: The Northern Ireland Parliament was abolished in 1972.

questions.question: When was the Northern Ireland Assembly established?
questions.explanation: The Northern Ireland Assembly was established after the Belfast (Good Friday) Agreement in 1998.

questions.question: How many members does the Northern Ireland Assembly have?
questions.explanation: There are 90 MLAs (Members of the Legislative Assembly) in Northern Ireland.

questions.question: What agreement led to the creation of the Northern Ireland Assembly?
questions.explanation: The Belfast (Good Friday) Agreement in 1998 established the Northern Ireland Assembly.

questions.question: What does the UK government have the power to do to devolved assemblies?
questions.explanation: The UK government can suspend devolved assemblies, as it has done in Northern Ireland.

questions.question: What are the official parliamentary reports called?
questions.explanation: Official reports of Parliamentâ€™s proceedings are called Hansard.

questions.question: Where can Hansard reports be found?
choices: Large libraries and online at parliament.uk
questions.explanation: Hansard reports are available in large libraries and online at www.parliament.uk.

questions.question: What does it mean that the UK has a 'free press'?
questions.explanation: A free press means newspapers are not controlled by the government.

questions.question: By law, what must radio and TV coverage of politics be?
questions.explanation: Radio and TV must give balanced coverage and equal time to different political viewpoints.
